chargeHist.descr: Violate/Harassment Restraining Order - Temporary Restraining Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony I Pena was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • STALKING, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Signed and Filed:  Order to Seal Proof of Treatment
The original document was titled: Proof of Treatment
The original history event date is: 08-30-2022
Received and Filed:  Proposed Order to Seal Treatment Record.
Received and Filed:   Proposed Order to Seal a Court Record

Defendant Anthony I Pena in court.  Attorney Kirk R. Emick in court for Anthony I Pena.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.  Court grants Defense's motion to seal treatment record. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 2 AND 3 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Sentencing proceeded. Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.  Additional statement made by Kaylen V. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS with 21 days credit, CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.

The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 3 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION IF REVOKED: 
- 6 MONTHS condition time at the House of Correction with Huber privileges for work and treatment, STAYED, to be used at the agent's discretion. 
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment. 
- Mental health examination and cooperate with any recommended treatment. 
- Complete a Cognitive Thinking program. 
- No contact with KTV. 
- Full-time work/school (minimum of 40 hours of work per week).
- Complete 75 hours of community service at a non-profit organization.  
- Provide DNA sample by 2:00 pm on 9-07-2022.
- Restitution set at $1,329.87 payable to KTV.

Court ordered the defendant to pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Cash bond on deposit is to be applied; remainder to be returned to the poster.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. 

20 day appeal rights given.

Defendant Anthony I Pena in court with attorney Joseph R Kennedy.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony I Pena appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

02:15 PM Defendant Anthony I Pena in court with attorney Joseph R Kennedy.  Defendant Anthony I Pena in custody.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony I Pena appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant hemay qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
